snippet: Babe Ruth went on an insurance-buying binge before the 1920 season, including a policy to protect against sickness or accidents that cost him $266.67, documents indicate.
abstract: Hartford insurance company is set to become official partner of Major League Baseball; deal recalls Babe Ruth's 1920 season, in which he went on an insurance-buying spree before joining the New York Yankees and doubling his salary; Ruth's purchases included a $266.67 policy from the Hartford for protection against sickness or accidents.
lead_paragraph: Babe Ruth went on an insurance-buying binge before the 1920 season, including a policy to protect against sickness or accidents that cost him $266.67, documents indicate.
